1.author: EeeTee
1.review:
This camera is a full featured entry level DSLR - if you are a seasoned pro you'll want to go with one of the pricier models, but if you are new to DSLR cameras and are looking to step up from a point and shoot camera to something much more powerful, this is a fine first step. 
This camera gives you full control over most parameters of your photography, but includes a broad spectrum of presets and automation as well that lets you work your way up to using all the manual tools - if you are a beginner, this camera will carry you for a few years before you begin chafing for something a bit more substantial!
The camera body is light and solidly built - all the controls are accessible via buttons on the exterior of the camera as well as through an easily navigable menu. The view screen is generous and bright, easily readable in most settings. The camera also offers a viewfinder which is very helpful when shooting in high glare settings (or when you forget to bring your glasses with you!) 
The included lenses cover a good range of distances, but you may want to invest in a wide angle lens - a good 12-20mm for getting more into your images (although most of the better ones out there will actually cost more than your camera did). The 75-300mm zoom lens will get you in close to many subjects, but don't expect it to compete with some of those 80x zooms you see on point and shoot cameras! 
Changing out lenses is easy and fast.
There are ample settings for one shot, continuous shot, and timed delay shooting, so if you are shooting an active event you can get some great movement shots, and if you want to get into the picture yourself, its easy to do. When shooting in continuous mode, the camera will pause after five shots to let the data catch up - I've found that three shots is the gets keeps me from getting that delay.
Both of these lenses shoot a little on the slow side. There is a slight hesitation after pressing the shutter release. I've also noticed that although the 18-55mm kit lens is equipped with an anti-shake feature, it really doesn't do much. So - consider adding a tripod to your purchase too!
The picture quality is excellent - I always shoot in RAW and this camera offers six RAW quality settings and the same for JPEG. Or you can choose to shoot both simultaneously if you don't know a lot about the formats and want to learn. Its great to have both formats to do side by side comparisons. 
This camera does not have an infrared sensor, so if you wish to use a remote, you'll have to use the Canon Camera Connect mobile app - it is available for both IOS and Android devices (sadly not for Windows 10 mobile devices though!). In addition to letting you control your camera remotely, the mobile apps also let you view the pictures on your camera on the bigger screens of your smartphone (I use my iPad - and its great to see a real time image for composition on that screen - believe me!) The app is pretty easy to use and so far I've found it to be stable and reliable, although more so on my iPad than on my Android phone. 
This camera is also capable of shooting HD movies and that is a terrific feature - but keep in mind, you'll have to master your lenses in order to stay in focus and do efficient zooms and pans. 
Overall this is a great camera. Canon lenses can be used on all their DSLR's, so when you are ready to upgrade to a more professional camera back, you'll be able to keep your lens kit and accessories.
1.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

2.author: Sportsjunkie79
2.review: This is a great starter DSLR camera kit. It comes with everything you need (minus a memory card) to take great pictures. You even get a bag that has room for the camera and extras. I heard and read many horror stories about kit lenses but these are pretty good even in low light. This kit is perfect for a beginner. Someone who isn't tech savvy and doesn't want to make a big investmsnt in a camera with a lot of bells and whistles they likely won't use. Then have to buy lenses separately. The T6 is easy to navigate and learn how to use. Especially if you're coming from a Canon point and shoot like I did. I went on YouTube and learned a lot watching videos and went on Canons website too which was very helpful. Canon makes a huge variety of lenses. Most of them are interchangeable with most of their camera bodies. You will have no problem upgrading or picking up other lenses that are better quality or suited for shooting different things should you choose to do so. I will probably pick up a 50mm lens here shortly. The T6 is fairly light and easy to carry compared to many other DSLRs I've seen. This is nice because you'll have it with you more often. The canon camera connect app works seamlessly for wireless transferring of your photos to your computer, phone or tablet which I personally LOVE. The downfall of this camera is the video quality. It may get somewhat better with a better quality lens but right now it is comparable to what my Galaxy S7 edge takes. This is an entry level DSLR through so it wouldn't be realistic to expect it to take extremely high quality video. All in all a good, easy to learn on starter DSLR camera kit for as reasonable of a price as you're going to find. I recommend it.
2.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

3.author: WallSt
3.review: Back in the hay day of 35mm film, I owned, a few Pentax and Canon Advantix Cameras, but I can't tell you how many rolls of film went undeveloped. With the invention of smart phones, all of my SLR camera's were relegated to the closet never to see the light of day again. I have tracked the prices of digital cameras over the last decade and never felt like I could justify purchasing a digital SLR until now. I must say, I am impressed with the value of modern day digital cameras, and I don't say that lightly. The last three trips I took to Thailand have been documented on Samsung android phones, but there are so many pictures that just don't translate the way you want, and since you can now get a complete camera set-up for about $300 less than a smart phone, why not own both? I am blow away by the ability to integrate your camera with your cell phone. The Canon T6 has the capability to connect with your smart phone so that you can mount the camera on a tripod and use your phone as the digital display. through WiFi or Bluetooth, you can upload the picture you want to post on Facebook whenever you want. Also, nothing is worse than missing a photo op because your phone is almost out of battery life. I haven't learned all of the features, but I can tell just from scratching the surface, that traveling with both, will give me the best of both worlds and the competition has not only made camera manufactures make better cameras, they are also very inexpensive. Go and check them out.. I purchased the Rebel T6 because Canon makes a very fine quality product and they have a lot off user support online. How long has the Rebel been around? At least 20 years, and though Nikon may be the choice of serious photographers, at the end of the day, if it isn't affordable and easy to use, what difference does it make.
3.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

4.author: Ness253
4.review:
I've given this camera a 4 only because we haven't yet developed or posted any photos online with this camera. Without factoring that in I'd definitely give it a 5. 

We had purchased this camera primarily for our developing E-Commerce business and the occasional vacation. While we have not yet reached the point of actually posting photos online or having any printed. They appear great on his widescreen computer screen and my 15" laptop screen. Being a beginner I highly suggest using the Manual setting first and adjusting as you go. This allows you to become more familiar with ISO & Aperture of the quality of photos you're interested in etc., if you're in the process of learning like me. Once you become comfortable then I'd understand venturing into the more advanced settings. 
In regards to size and weight, it's perfect for my tiny hands! I don't find myself hunched over or having to adjust my hands frequently. It's lightweight (I'd say less than 5lbs) with the standard lens attachment.

Setting up the camera is pretty easy if you're all about reading the Manual first -- like me. I've toyed around with connecting it to my Samsung S7 and found it quick and easy to set up. Although remember to turn off the Wi-Fi/NFC setting afterwards, otherwise you will not be able to access other functions such as connecting it to your computer (e.g. uploading).
Overall, if you're a beginner or simply looking for an affordable, light-weight substitute to a camera you currently have this is a great option. It definitely makes photography less intimidating but as with any hobby or profession, do not be afraid to do some research! It'll help in the long run.
4.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

5.author: Mike
5.review:
The EOS Rebel T6 is easy to use in the automatic and other modes, especially if one is used to other Cannons. I bought the new 6T to replace my older EOS Rebel XS that I had for about 10 years old)but was damaged when the top of a lens cleaner fluid bottle squirted out and wet the camera and lens. Cannon no longer repaired them and it seemed better to buy a new camera than to try to repair it--the curse of modern society.

The T6, like its predecessor is very easy for the casual or beginning photographer to use in the automatic mode or other settings on the dial,
 for example, scenery or close up flowers. It also allows for more flexibility in manual and other settings if one wants to experiment or shoot in low light situations. The lens quality seems good, although I have not yet tested the 300mm lens in low light conditions. One minor drawback was that when first tried out the camera taking photos of Lake Champlain from a park overlooking the water and used the automatic mode, the photos came out very washed out. However after experimenting with AE and other settings, the colors seemed more true. Another minor annoyance is that although the battery is the same size as the one used for the older EOS rebel, the connecting points are different so cannot use my two old spare batteries and charger. It is annoying the way manufacturers keep making minor changes that make obsolete previously good pieces of equipment. Nevertheless, the T6 seems to be a fine camera for most uses, ranging from taking pictures of fast moving children to landscape shots.
5.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

6.author: Hima
6.review: As much research as I did, you CANNOT beat this deal!! It felt like a huge risk buying it from amazon and I noticed some reviews said some things were missing, I was so worried about spending so much money and something go wrong... but I am SO GLAD I took that risk!!!! It was perfect! Everything was there. I even had the canon bag ( I’m assuming it’s because I chose the premium bundle!) but the bag really only fits, ( the camera, and the lenses and a couple small items) so I will be buying a bigger bag anyways so none of that made a difference to me. Seriously, the camera was in perfect condition, everything. I registered the camera with canon too! The gear that comes with it really is great, I mean some of it you can tell is cheap but does it work? YES! It all works. I think everything works fine except the flash drive, the metal piece for the USB port came off, but I wasn’t going to use a flash drive anyways. But ritz camera has contacted me wanting to know how everything was and I’m sure they would love to help you with any problems you may have! This is seriously the best deal and I’m so happy with everything!
6.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

7.author: Jack
7.review_title: Took it back due to non-functioning usb port
7.review:
This camera takes Fantastic pictures compared to any point and shoot camera. However, it is a pain to get everything set up. Don't let the WiFi fool you, it's not completely networkable (I expected it to act like network attached storage or something, but it doesn't) and getting it to transfer over WIFI is more trouble than it's worth. Also, some advanced features require using the USB interface, which simply didn't work for me. I took it back after spending a couple of hours fiddling with software downloads and such trying to get it to work. I'm reasonably tech-savvy, and it was still painful to work through all the settings.

One thing that was dissapointing is that the camera does not autofocus in video mode. There is no good reason for that. A camera this good should be able to double as a decent videocamera too, and it would only be software to make it happen. 

I wound up buying a Nikon D3400 instead. It's video autofocus is rough, but better than nothing on the Canon. It takes pictures that are about the same quality and costs about the same. (I price matched Walmart's price). Its bluetooth connection is easier to deal with than the Canon's WiFi.
7.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

8.author: MemoriesByMyan808
8.review:
I was a "Point-N-Shooter" and wanted to upgrade to a DSLR without paying my entire life savings! This bundle is fantastic! The 18-55mm kit lens is amazing however, the 75-300mm I don't use much because it doesn't have the stabilizer like the 18-55 so there for you NEED a tripod! I also purchased the 50mm f1.8 Canon lens as well in the same order! The order I got is absolutely amazing! So you may wanna invest in a 50mm lens as well if your looking at this review! But overall I rate it a 9/10 only reason being is it dosnt have an articulated screen and I wasn't about to spend an extra $200+ on the T6i just for more MP and a tilty screen! Overall amazing! I love it! 
Sincerely,
MemoriesByMyan(:
8.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

9.author: smvsmvsmv
9.review:
I purchased a Canon EOS Rebel T6 at Best Buy 10 days ago in anticipation of a 5 week long trip to Italy. 
I am now in Italy and after using the camera for 5 days it is totally DEAD. 
I contacted Canon and their customer "service" walked me through several procedures to make sure it wasn't a battery or sim card issue and after about 1 minute I was informed it is a "circuit board issue". Of course, there is nothing that can be done about it other than to ship the camera to Canon and hope they can repair it (but if course that leaves me without a camera during my trip). Amazingly when I asked the canon rep to send me an e-mail to confirm that I had called within the warranty period and reported the defect I was told that Canon customer service "does not have the ability to send an outgoing e-mail". How can you provide service and not be able to send an e-mail? Completely ridiculous and clearly designed to make it frustrating for customers with issues. 

Nikon makes an equivalent product for a similar price. I suspect Nikon's product lasts longer than ONE WEEK.
9.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

10.author: CameraCustomer
10.review_title: So Loud I HATE it and horrible video.
10.review:
This is my first DSLR and I hate it. I've been using quality long zoom point and shoot cameras for 15 years and thought it was finally time to get a DSLR for higher quality pictures.
It takes nice pictures if that is all you want but...
If you are in a quiet place people will turn and stare. I wanted a camera I could use to take quality pictures at my children's concerts. The mirror slam and shutter are so loud I would be embarrassed to use it. 
Video is terrible if anything moves. With the normal settings it won't focus while taking video. If you change the settings to autofocus during video it does a horrible job - focusing in and out until if finally settles on something and the motor is so loud the sound quality on the video is ruined. Finally, unlike every point and shoot I've owned you cannot take pictures during video. That means turning the dial all the way around, taking a picture, and returning to video. 
And there is a $67.50 restocking fee if I want to return it.
THIS WAS THE WORST PURCHASE EVER!
10.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

11.author: FargoDrew
11.review_title: Excellent beginner DSLR for the price.
11.review: We wanted a good DSLR for photographing birds, lake scenery, wind farms, animals, people, and flowers. I'm not a professional photographer but know enough about using "Pro" features from a couple of high end Samsung phones that have "Pro Mode". We have been testing depth of field photography with this camera and so far the results are so good for the price point you are buying this camera at. The telephoto lens has been a treat to photograph our lake with, and the standard 18-55mm lens worked great for photographing a recent graduation ceremony. Using sport mode on this camera I was able to capture the students throwing their hats in the air after the ceremony and again, the results were great. My recommendation is to spend some time researching taking quality photos, this is an excellent camera that can do some amazing work if you know what you are doing, and if you don',t the point and shoot option of "Auto" works great. I'd recommend this as an option over your "Digital" $150.00 dollar jobbers any day, it's a great package.
11.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

12.author: CameraD
12.review:
Great camera -- exactly as described

January 18, 2018


CameraD 

from Indiana







I have always loved taking pictures, but I wanted to take it up a notch from my simpler camera that I have had for over ten years. I wanted the option to learn how to manually adjust settings and use lenses to create an effect. At the same time, I wanted something simple that I could use in a more active setting with my five children -- when I needed a quick just "point and snap" option. I have only had it since Christmas (about one month) and have mostly used the automatic settings, but I have loved the increased quality. The prints are clear and are easy to have blown up -- whereas my past camera took good pictures, but they were not high quality enough to blow up and frame. I think that this camera is great for beginners who want to dive deeper into photography for themselves or professional use. It has been an adjustment to carry around a larger camera. For me, it is worth it for the better quality pictures.
12.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

13.author: Sara0327
13.review:
This camera is exactly what you are looking for if you want to get into photography! It takes great quality photos both near and far shots. Plus, it comes with the long zoom lense with the bundle which is a major plus since that lense cost $100 on its own. This is definitely the camera kit to buy if you do not want to spend a ton, but don’t want to risk great quality. 
The only downside I see with this camera is that the focus will shutter constantly until you can get it set exactly where it needs to be. The T6i model quickly adjusts where it needs to go without the constant shuttering. However, T6i is a big upgrade with a hefty price. Overall, I would say this is the way to go for great quality photos of you are a beginner or want to take great family time pictures.
13.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

14.author: BirdNerd
14.review: This is my first DSLR camera and I am totally amazed at the resolution of the pictures I am getting. The auto settings make it so easy for a beginner to get amazing shots. The 75mm - 300mm lens is a must if you want to photograph wildlife. I'm a bird enthusiast and have gotten some amazing crisp clear close ups with this lens. The 18-55mm is great for landscapes, family photos, etc. I couldn't be happier with my selection. I only wish the instructions were a little easier. They assume you already know a lot about the different settings i.e. ISO, F-stop, shutter speed etc. and functions of the camera. But they do offer free on-line classes. I'm so glad I bought the camera package.
14.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

15.author: melS
15.review: This kit is great for novice photographers that are just getting started. Also perfect for personal use to achieve higher quality snap shots or videos than a cell phone camera can offer. The two pieces this kit does not come with that I would recommend right away would be a memory card and a lens filter. The lens filter will protect from accidental scratches and is way cheaper to replace than the whole lens. If you plan of photographing in low light you'll want to upgrade the flash as well. This camera does not have a very good flash built in, in fact, I make sure never to use it because it usually results in terrible pictures. Overall, I suggest this kit... it's a great camera!
15.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

16.author: Photodude
16.review:
I was used to a point and shoot camera (which I still love and use a LOT) but decided it was time to also get back into a camera with more options for when we retire and hopefully do more traveling. 

This will be a camera 'along with' my compact camera, as this Canon is definitely heavier and more chunky to maneuver. 

I used to have a DSLR camera in years past and so I had 'some' knowledge of how to begin to use this camera. But there are so many options that it would be 'very' helpful to have some training on how to utilize all it has to offer. 

I was told they used to include a DVD on how to use this product, but when I called the store they said they no longer do so. 

We have had point and shoot Canons in the past so we are trusting this is another of their great products.

Now we just need to discover all it has to offer us : ))) Good problem to have, I guess. Thanks Canon!
16.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

17.author: Sarah
17.review: I purchased this camera to start learning photography. An actual photographer recommended it to me. I am very pleased with my purchase. It is easy to use and also has a lot of different options when shooting. I also purchased the extra lense that I will use after I really get a grasp on the camera. It came with instructions of course but since I am a visual/hands-on learner, I looked it up on YouTube. They have very cool videos that breakdown each camera setting and option on the camera. I have already taken some really awesome pictures of my family. I would definitely recommend to someone interested in photography or just interested in taking some good quality family photos!
17.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

18.author: Bigred2
18.review: I am thrilled with this camera. I bought this camera to use on my trip this year to the South Seas Islands i. e. Tahiti, Bora Bora and the rest of the Society Islands. I wanted something that would catch a great shot and do justice to the photography. This camera is very easy to use. If I can follow the directions to getting this camera ready, anyone can. I've been known to be mechanically challenged at times and this was easy. It takes great pictures, good sharp images, brilliant color and excellent enhancements that other cameras do not provide. This product exceeded my expectations. I bought this camera at Best Buy. I am sure glad I did, .because my salesperson was very helpful and made sure that I knew what I wanted. He also gave me some tips on this camera which I really appreciated. This was an ideal shopping experience for me - a great camera and Super Service.
18.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

19.author: Lmmproductionservices
19.review_title: Excellent buy if you get it on sale
19.review: This camera is a all around work horse. I have been a canon user for over 10 years and recently jumped on the Sony train. I recently wanted to grab a cheaper canon to use on family vacations. Mainly I knew I would just throw it in a bag with a 35mm on it and not worry about dings or scratches when I am out. The t6 is light,performance is on par with a sl1 or a t5i. Good ISO performance up to 3200. Fires at 4 frames a second so general photography is a good fit. As far as the kit lens, I honestly sold it the minute I got it. Never been a fan of the older 18-55.to loud,slow and cheaply built. The kit I bought had a 75-300. It is fine as a telephoto. The 55-250 stm is a much better lens however. More then likely I will sell that as well. As a body only this camera works great! Great as a beginner camera or as a travel backup. Great buy when it's on sale!
19.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

20.author: ONEIDIOTWITHACAMERA
20.review:
After liking my photography class in high school I decided I would buy a camera. Being that my assignments came from photoshop, I figured this would be a good camera to get started out with. Now I'm what you would call "one idiot with a camera", but with this camera I feel like I'm a bit less of an idiot. I've watched some youtube videos, my girlfriend is helping me and its a very 'well put together' camera. It seems to take great photos. The one thing I wish I could change, if I could change it, would be I have no idea how to not take a picture without the flash. But I'm sure thats just me "one idiot with a camera" not knowing what I'm doing.
For the price and wanting to get into photography or even taking great photos this is an absolute must buy, I don't think you'll be disappointed.
20.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

21.author: thrall
21.review_title: A great Camera at a Great Price
21.review: We wanted something better than the camera we had, but didn't want to spend a lot of money, especially as we're not camera buffs, just folks who like to take nice pics on occasion. This kit fills the bill and then some. We've shot over 500 great photos in the short time we've had it, and they are flawless! The Rebel T6 is easy to operate, yet has sophisticated features for more in depth work. The second lens included also allows for more creativity and variance. I would highly recommend this set for just about anyone due to its versatility and price.
21.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

22.author: Aphrodezecat
22.review:
This is the most money I've ever spent personally on a camera. I AM SO FREAKING EXCITED TO HAVE THIS! I was sold after reading a lot of the reviews. 
I will say there is SO much to learn, and it is a little overwhelming..(even though I really have perfected my cell-phone selfies..that is about the extent of my knowledge on cameras) ..but I am not deterred, and very excited to learn to get the most from my camera. I have already been able to take some pictures, and can tell it's quality..However, I do feel I am lacking in it's powers of quality though..but only because of my lack of knowing how to use most of the features on the camera. 
(after some experience I will come back and update this review :) )
22.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

23.author: Liz1993
23.review: I love this camera so far. It's a great camera for a beginner, is well priced, and I like the two lenses and case that came with the camera. I would definitely recommend this product if you think you may use a regular lense as well as a zoom lense. One thing to keep in mind is that the Canon lenses are great quality, and you can always upgrade the body later if you choose! Love the WiFi on the camera - as someone who does a lot of camping/backpacking, I am able to send the photos to my phone while on the go (and out of cell phone/wifi range). Also, Best Buy often offers photography classes which is a great help if you're new to using a camera. Definitely recommend buying this set from Best Buy! Just don't forget the memory chip :)
23.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

24.author: Jimmy
24.review: This camera came with a nice bundle. 2 lenses and a camera bag. I wanted to advance myself past a point and shoot pocket camera. I am still in the learning process of what setting I need to use in different lighting. I bought the camera for the bundle after reading only a few buyer reviews and what I thought a reasonable price. I did eventually find this particular camera online with more accessories and a slightly lower price but with Best Buy I was able to take advantage of 12 months same as cash and a Best Buy gift card I received from my job. So far my pictures have turned out pretty good but with a little more practice under my belt I expect them to be great. The pro's review this as a great starter camera so it fits my experience level.
24.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

25.author: ChuckS
25.review_title: Too early to tell but so far so good
25.review: This one was a gift for my daughter but I recently bought myself the same camera, my first digital SLR. I've owned a Nikon 35mm and 2 Canon point and shoot digital cameras and have had luck with both so it was a tough brand choice. I bought this one mainly because of my previous experience with my other Canon camera which was and still is trouble free after 5 years and I use it a lot for my business. Sometimes I shoot 150+ pictures at a time. I've shot with my new DSLR several times now and I like the shots I get and also the ease of use on the camera. I have a lot to learn about it still but having the fully automatic mode to help out until I do learn more is very helpful. Overall I am very pleased. Otherwise I wouldn't have bought a second one for my 18yr. old daughter
25.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

26.author: NotTechSavyFemale
26.review:
I've been looking at getting a DSLR for quite a while. I read the reviews, looked at Cannon's website, and also spoke with a friend who owned a previous version of this camera.
I'm so glad I got this camera. The pictures are beautiful and it's been fairly easy to learn to use. I do recommend going to Cannon's website- there is a series of video tutorials that teach you about the camera and different elements; also how to adjust settings for different situations.
26.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

27.author: Rocket13
27.review: After wanting a DSLR for years, but not wanting to spend that much money on myself, needing a phone upgrade I took advantage of the upgrade gift card promotion and then applied the gift card towards the camera. This camera is a breeze to use for somebody with only point and shoot experience. With every picture I take I am amazed at the color and quality of the photos. So far I have only used the auto focus and settings. I am currently reading and watching videos to take advantage of all the potential the camera has. I added a picture of my wifes dog who was a willing model.
27.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

28.author: Milankumar
28.review:
I purchased Two DSLR Canon EOS T6 camera with two lenses. But one camera I was sent already to INDIA and they complained about this stupid camera was not working either the it’s not starting.
So I really don’t know about this kind of situation. What should I do now and please you can refund me or send me a new one which is working perfectly.
I really disappointed this time.
I finally decided I never buy anything from Best Buy’s because I don’t trust on Best Buy online product.
And I know this camera I was sent already to India and it’s never come back. They already thrown this product.
Thank you.
28.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

29.author: Nicholec9853
29.review: When I seen this camera I immediately wanted it. I searched around other websites to see if it was the best camera for me. I initially made my purchase from amazon. I cancelled it on cyber Monday and ordered the exact same one from Best buy for pickup that day. The size of the camera is easy to manage and not too heavy to carry around your neck. In auto mode you can take amazing pictures. Other mode features are great too but for me as a beginner I have not took to many in those modes. I recommend this camera to anyone.
29.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

30.author: apparentlyaiden
30.review: I bought this on Black Friday of 2016 because I felt like I wanted to buy a camera, but didn't want to spend more than 400 dollars. If you're considering a DSLR, WAIT UNTIL BLACK FRIDAY. The sale might not be exactly the same, but I got this bundle plus an SD card for under $400 because I wanted a month. I saved about fifty percent because I waited and I strongly recommend you do a bit of research into the pros and cons of each camera. The only downside is that the screen on this camera does not move, though most of the time you'll be using the viewfinder anyway. The video quality and mic quality is good, obviously not the best sound, but better than a smartphone. Overall, I'd give this probably a 9/10.
30.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

31.author: CP35
31.review: These days it is hard to justify dropping a ton of money on a camera when cellphones are so convenient and actually have good enough quality for your facebook or instagram post, however I really really wanted something better for a trip I have coming up to Europe. The person at Best Buy offered a lot of advice and had recently come back from a similar trip and highly recommended this deal for what I was looking for. I am really glad I listened, the camera came with two lenses and was easy to use for a novice, but not limiting as I become more experienced with settings to be able to customize my shots. I would definitely recommend this camera.
31.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

32.author: Caitlin
32.review_title: This is an overall great camera for beginners
32.review: This camera is great for people who want to start photography. It has an easy to understand handbook and it is a very simple to use. It is a camera that is great for pet photography and nature photography. I have done photoshoots of my friends as well and they absolutely fell in love with the photos. I have received many compliments regarding the quality of my photos! And editing is a big helper to show your unique style through photography so don't always rely solely on the camera itself.
32.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

33.author: Dclv702
33.review: I did a lot of research on the cameras before I finally bought a DSLR. I know a little bit about them but definitely not a professional. I'm happy with this one. My daughter started all-star cheerleading and with this package it came with the extended lens which I needed. All the reviews that came in said the only big huge difference with this camera compared to the lower model was the Wi-Fi capability. I bought mine during Black Friday so pricewise it wasn't that much more. I absolutely love the Wi-Fi feature hands-down I would've paid an extra hundred dollars for it. I love the fact that you just download the app connect the camera to your phone and Bam you have the pictures on your phone. I love this camera it's a great buy.
33.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

34.author: Andrea
34.review:
I received this camera for Christmas and have been using it since. I am new to the world of DSLR photography and have found this camera relatively easy to use. I also like that a camera bag and two lenses were included, though many online agree that the zoom lens is par at best. Still, for something you are
getting as an added bonus, I can’t complain. I am going to be purchasing the “nifty fifty” Canon 50mm lens soon and a wide angle lens soon to take my photography to the next level.
34.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

35.author: R1234
35.review: I am amazed by this camera, I have been saving up for a DSLR camera and this one is just right for a beginner and also for someone with experience in camera photo taking. It was awesome how it came with an additional lens & the case which was the reason I decided to buy it because I didn't want to pass up the sale it was having. For the price I believe it is a great camera that takes great quality photos, the instruction manual is filled with great tips and the fact that lenses can be bought for this camera is a great addition. I am having a fun time with this new camera!
35.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

36.author: Marty25
36.review: Won't be able to find a better camera with the accessories included at this price point. Bought it so that I could take newborn photos versus paying someone the same price. Was able to take professional looking photos and have the camera now as little guy grows up. Attached a quick, simple photo of our cat so you can see the quality.
36.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

37.author: Chel26
37.review: I was given this camera as a mothers day gift and I'm in love with it! The first t6 I was given had a faulty shutter and I had to return it which was inconvenient but Best Buy made it an easy quick exchange. I am a beginner when it comes to dslr cameras but so far the t6 has been user friendly and easy to learn. My pictures are crisp and clear without me adjusting the settings all the time. My favorite part of the camera is the wifi capability. It's so easy to transfer photos directly to my phone without the hassle of connecting to a computer. I'll never go back to a camera without wifi.
37.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

38.author: hotshot
38.review: One of my coworkers inspired me to get this camera. He does excellent photography work and after looking at all his final results I was amazed. The photos were so realistic and beautiful that I wanted to create something like that. I asked him for some advice and he told me to get this camera, and since it was a Black Friday deal, I decided that I'll take a shot at it. I've snapped so many pictures and was satisfied with the quality it portrayed. I think this camera is definitely worth the buy, especially as a beginner and not knowing anything about photography, I picked up quickly. It is an easy camera to use and I was able to work my way around in less than a week. Definitely satisfied with my buy!
38.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

39.author: CanonFanNow
39.review: WORTH EVERY PENNY!! PHENOMENAL PICTURES!! Bought this camera to take on a 2-week European river cruise and it was the best investment I made this year. Even the distance photos with the telephoto lens came out clear and focused. After viewing my pics, a friend asked me about the camera and told him the specifics and the GREAT DEAL I got at Best Buy; he went and bought it! I never was a photobug before, but this camera has infected me with the need!! BTW, I shot 4,283 pics over the 2 week period. Gotta love digital photography!! Each photo was 7 MB (20 megapixel camera) and a total of 25 GB for the quantity of pics I shot; these can all easily fit on a 32 GB SD card.
39.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

40.author: Heather
40.review: So in love with my canon rebel t6! This is my very first DSLR camera and i couldn't have made a better purchase. Im a beginner at DSLR cameras. But you dont have to be a pro to handle and to make professional pictures. Because every picture taken with the canon rebel t6 is going to look gorgeous and absolutely professional. I highly recommend the canon rebel t6 to anyone!! Oh and an awesome bonus is the built in WIFi!!! Love love love it!!! Go get yourself the canon rebel t6!!! You wont be disappointed, I promise!
40.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

41.author: TPham
41.review: I work for one of the S shops at my military college and I wanted to use my own personal camera instead of renting one out. I read a good chunk of the reviews for this camera and I have to say that it definitely meets expectations. It's a great camera for someone who is a beginner/novice in the photography field. The fact that I can attach a different kind of lens on is great, because distance action shots are really hard to catch. It was such a great deal, don't pass it up! I highly recommend this camera
41.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

42.author: redwingcody
42.review:
This seems like an awesome bundle to get started with DSLR photography. The camera itself is solid and I'm still discovering how to use it. I'm sure I don't scratch the surface of its capabilities. I like that it came with two lens options.
Only a couple complaints: larger lens doesn't have Image Stabilization, lenses don't come with storage pouches or a lens hood, the included camera bag is pretty bare bones and small, the included camera neck strap is too skinny and is uncomfortable around my neck.
42.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

43.author: Cmpowers
43.review: It is hard to justify a large camera expense given the quality and accessibility of cellphones these days. However, the price was right for the Rebel t so I bit the bullet and purchased it given an upcoming trip to the French Alps. It is early days with the camera still so I will come back and update my review if anything changes, but I've been really satisfied with the quality improvement of the images I've been able to capture. Having the long zoom lens has also been a game changer. Easy to navigate for a novice with enough access in the manual modes to grow with you as a photographer
43.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

44.author: bergie
44.review: I stopped by the best buy store looking for a camera that would be good for beginners since I've never owned more than a camera phone. I spoke with one of the associates in the store and they recommended this one. I trusted his opinion and couldn't imaging a better camera. I took a trip to Hawaii right after buying and was so happy i did. Pictures are 100x better than with my iphone! definitely would recommend!
44.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

45.author: Louie
45.review: I am still learning about it , but so far I have enjoyed using the digital part, rather than film like I used to have. The bag I don't really like , because it is so small and won't hold the camera well when the 300 lens is on the camera! And, if I get any other accessories the bag won't accommodate them! I need a bag that can accommodate both lenses without having to rip the velcro partitions out and reposition them each time I change lenses! It's too time consuming, and lens aren't protected from rattling around in bag. I would rather use my old camera bag!
45.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

46.author: JosMagan
46.review_title: It is fun and practical to use.
46.review:
I was able to use all my lenses and attachments from my old Canon film camera That I used before. The advantage that I save in film and development that I used before and also the ability to be more creative with all the features that the camera allows me to use.
Even as I was using for several years a point and shoot camera that I manage very well even for publication of photos and videos I got now the felling that I am more profesional again .
46.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

47.author: FirePhoto
47.review: So far, so good. Easy enough to put the pieces in place, a bit harder to double check that the registration went through, but found out that Best Buy package took care of that for me, which is a relief. So far only had to use the one lens for regular zooming. But is doesn t look hard to switch lenses. Sturdy camera, works good in low light. Enetered a couple of pictures into contests already, and, while no winners, did place a few times, and on shots that I intended to be above average.
47.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

48.author: peabody
48.review_title: Having fun with this new camera takes awesome pics
48.review: Bought this camera as a replacement for a Sony that was stolen from my vehicle. Have never owned a Canon. Always had Olympus or Sony. I am loving this camera and am currently enrolled in an adult Ed. camera course to learn the more technical aspects. On my first day with this new camera I went to a zoo and this camera, right out of the box took great pictures. I was then able to download the Canon programs that assisted me in tweaking all my pictures with cropping and resizing. It is user friendly when the auto selection is used to take the pictures. Thanks for a great product!
48.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

49.author: Waldeck
49.review:
I have not had an DLR camera since my old Pentax film camera back in the 90's. I've had digital cameras yet I was missing the ability to change lenses and use different filters.
From the short time i've had this camera I've been very pleased with it. As soon as the weather turns more into spring, I'll be spending a lot of time outside.
With the addition of step up/down rings, I am able to use my old filters and some of the lenses.
Looking forward to lots of great pictures in the near future. The pictures I have taken look extremely good. The colors seem to almost jump right off my computers screen.
49.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

50.author: Newtophotography
50.review: I wanted a beginners camera that would allow me to begin to take some decent wildlife shots. I took advice from a member of staff at, Best Buy knowing little to nothing myself about cameras, except a few things I picked up doing online research. This boxed set reprints excellent value is easy to use and allows me to take some great pictures. It's a good all round camera, good for family snaps, close ups of nature and longer distance wildlife shots. I just want a stronger lense now for really good long distance shots! Better start saving!
50.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

51.author: rand
51.review_title: Great first camera for my Daughter
51.review:
The camera package was to include a cleaning kit, however, supplies ran out and I did not receive a substitute. My Daughter really liked the idea of everything being included. When I told her that it had been taken off of the order, she said to cancel the order. I assured her that Best Buys has always been reasonable and that they would fix it. 
I called the Geek Squad and was told to call customer service, which I did and was on hold for 45 Minutes. I finally had to hang up. Please
make this right and send me a voucher for a cleaning kit. Thanks
51.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

52.author: DrgRacr
52.review_title: Easy first step into the world of DSLR
52.review: I bought this for my daughter so I could get lots of great pictures of my two grandsons ;) She had been wanting a "real" camera for a while so she could set up her own photo shoots and such as that. I researched this camera vs the comparable Nikon, and chose this one because the user interface looked like it would be easier to use/understand for a novice user. I knew that if it seemed too difficult or deep, she wouldn't explore all the features/options. So far so good, she really likes it and I'm getting the pictures I wanted :)
52.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

53.author: kaak
53.review_title: Everything You Need To Get Started
53.review: A complete set with everything you need for taking great pictures. The quality is outstanding as you would expect from Canon. This is the perfect camera for someone who has at least a basic understanding of camera jargon like ISO, Fish Eye, Telephoto, Panoramic for example. I also think it would be best for someone at least 12 years old. The instruction book (included) is a great tool for learning about the camera and its features. Was able to start taking pictures within a few minutes of reading the instruction book.
53.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

54.author: VKTerp
54.review_title: Awesome, super easy, fun and great battery
54.review: This camera does it all. Easy to work with right out of the box, it came with multiple lenses and easily comes apart for the bag/backpack you're using. We took it to Italy, and it worked out great. Battery lasts really long and quality of the device is great. The pictures look phenomenal and the settings weren't too overwhelming. For a beginner, I highly recommend this. It was right in our budget, and worked out really well for our trip and I'm sure we'll be taking it on future trips.
54.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

55.author: MDJavis
55.review_title: A great camera for getting started
55.review: The EOS Rebel T6 DLSR camera is a great and affordabe camera for the home. It is easy to get used to using, even if you don't use it a lot, the different settings are easy to remember with the on screen messages. it takes some skill to get used to catching action shots, but this camera gives you the ability to do so without having to remember to change a bunch of settings. easy lens change, finding i need an intermediate lens between the two that come in package.
55.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

56.author: Sonnet
56.review: Awesome Camera!! I love it!!! Back in 1999 I purchased a Canon Rebel camera (non digital) and I have been very apprehensive about purchasing a digital since technology changes so quickly.... I love this camera though. I have been using it a lot for youth hockey action shots, where there is netting or plexi-glass between me and the skater, the settings allow me to manually focus on the player, not the netting. Lighting options are very important, every ice rink varies. I have truly been enjoying this camera!!!!
56.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

57.author: enunezjr4
57.review:
I did a lot of research before I decided to purchase this camera. Basically it boils down to a few things. 
1) I'm new to DSLRs. I've never purchased more than a point and shoot camera. This is a great starter camera to learn the ropes
2) The lenses that came with the camera are pretty basic. The zoom is decent on the larger lens and the standard lens will do quite a bit
3) Price. There are better cameras out there, there are other lenses. But if you don't know what you're doing, why drop the cash?
4) Interchangeable lenses, this is a pretty standard feature on DSLR cameras.
57.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

58.author: brian10
58.review_title: Great Camera for the true Beginner!
58.review: This camera was bought for my girlfriend who is just beginning to get into photography and she was pretty happy with it, but I have more experience with cameras than she does and was not fully satisfied. The pictures the T6 took were a bit too blurry or out of focus even when using the autofocus feature. In manual mode, getting a well lit, sharp, and stable image without using the flash was difficult because it would either be too blurry or too noisy or both. Great for long exposure pictures though!
58.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

59.author: Keyman
59.review: I am really impressed with this camera and, having shopped for over a year to find what was best for me, this really suits my needs. It is easy to learn with minimal learning curve (I'm an old school analog man), and the quality is awesome. I shoot a lot of sunrises and sunsets as well as pictures on the beach and reflections of the sun on the Gulf and on rivers and bayous, and this camera captures the natural beauty of my Creator. This was a wise and good investment for me. Thanks Canon and Best Buy
59.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

60.author: MoVa
60.review_title: Solid DSLR camera with quick focus
60.review: Great DSLR camera and photos are very crisp! The autofocus works super quick. Much quicker than my older Nikon DSLR. Used it at my nephew's birthday and captured some amazing in-the-moment photos. The very fast autofocus justified this camera purchase. One suggestion, get a different case. The case that came with the camera isn't very useful if you're always on the move. The open flap top gets cumbersome after a while. If you're on the move a lot (ie. snapping photos at the zoo or a wedding) get a camera bag with a zip open top. That said, great DSLR camera!
60.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

61.author: Mikey
61.review_title: Great camera to start out, with amazing mid lvl
61.review: Got this for my wife for Xmas and she loves it. After moving to Alaska we needed something to capture the amazing northern lights and this does the job in more. With simple setup it made it quick to start shooting out of the box and with so many options I know my wife can go even farther with it. The screen does not do the pictures justice, once you get it onto your phone or computer you'll see how great those shots actually are. Plus the built in wifi makes it super easy for my wife to quickly download to her phone and post with ease. Great camera
61.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

62.author: RobK
62.review:
I chose the Rebel T6 over the Nikon D3400 for the following reasons. 

1. I prefer all the buttons on one side of the camera, easily accessible with my thumb even if I’m looking through the viewfinder. 

2. The Canon lenses were far quieter when zooming or focusing compared to Nikon. 

3. Canon just felt much more solid. 

4. As someone who has never used a DSLR before, the camera helped me take amazing pictures all based on the auto settings.
62.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

63.author: Tammy
63.review: I have been looking at this camera for a long time and decided to go ahead and get while it was on sale. I know nothing about these types of cameras and thought that i would be able to take pictures of grandchildren. To me this is a complicated camera and i had no idea there was so much involved in taking pictures. I think that when i get used to it there would be no doubt that i bought the perect camera for my needs. Glad i made this purchase. I have wanted one for years and never been in the position to get one.
63.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

64.author: Yvaniaandabel
64.review_title: Good Camera but not for beginners
64.review: I initially bought this camera for my husband because he was tired of the basic digital cameras. Although the camera itself takes good pictures, the settings are a bit confusing, He had to youtube videos on how to take raw shots vs normal pictures. The lenses make the camera very heavy and it becomes hard to hold it still. You can only get 5 pictures per second so this was not good when we tried taking pictures of the kids running or in action. Needless to say we will be returning it for the mirrorless sony alpha 6000.
64.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

65.author: APCHouston
65.review: The last SLR I used was a Canon and I decided to get back into photography and get something that not too expensive but with good enough specs. So this bundle fit the bill very well. While the image sensor is not the densest, it still takes pretty good pictures. However take time to read the manual or go to youtube for tutorials. There are a lot of options in can become overwhelming. At setting it to auto mode defeats the purpose of getting a DSLR to begin with. But I'm happy with it so far.
65.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

66.author: Brookelyn
66.review:
I love this camera! I am an amiture photographer and a new mother. Picked this up so I could start capturing quality photos of these moments that are going by way too fast! Great quality while user friendly. Was just easy to lean. The only two things I wish were different...
1. The quality of the screen on the camera was higher(pictures look 100x better after uploading to my phone or computer)
2. No imput for external microphone.
Other than that, this is a great starter camera! Much needed upgrade from my sx130is!
66.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

67.author: TyleN
67.review_title: Great Entry Level Camera, Valuable Starter Bundle
67.review: We purchased this camera for our daughter who is currently enrolled in a digital media course at school. The class utilizes Canon cameras and we wanted to get her one that she could use on her own but would be familiar to her. This bundle had everything she could want to get started in photography. I was very pleased with the price and the features offered. The bundled lenses and case are a great value as well. We even received a free memory card. Very happy with our purchase.
67.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

68.author: Pete
68.review: At first I was a little overwhelmed. But reading the instructions and using the settings helped. After awhile I practiced using other settings and I found this camera was easy to use. I found using this camera to be fun and it takes great pictures. There is clarity and the colors are bright. We went to Niagara Falls and used this camera, oh what good memories.
68.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

69.author: RWeb
69.review: We got this camera after our daughter was born for those 'more than cell phone picture' moments. There are a lot of options on the camera settings wise that take some getting used to and learning in order to do any special type pictures (such as sharp subject but blurry background) but the auto mode works well in the meantime. I just play around with the different modes to see which works best. The WiFi option is great as you can just connect with your phone to grab the pictures you want for saving or uploading.
69.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

70.author: bluice62
70.review: I bought this on sale, it is my first digital SLR but not my first Canon. I was not disappointed at all, both lenses work great and I've gotten excellent pictures with this set, beats my Samsung Galaxy hands down. Definitely worth the money.
70.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

71.author: Wferg
71.review:
Bought this for a trip to the Great Smoky Mnts. It was comfortable on the trail and took great photos from the top of Clingman's Dome! The auto focus a great for taking easy snapshots starting out. Switching to the manual focus allows greater control. Additionally, Canon has an app where you can use the built in wifi to transfer your photos to your phone so sharing on social media is easy.

I'd definitely recommend buying a card reader, though, as well for transferring to your computer quickly.
71.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

72.author: LTB83
72.review_title: Good for a novice if you research how to use
72.review: My husband got this for me so I could start taking better pictures of the kiddos. It was super frustrating to use the first few times because I was winging it on using the features and not getting good results. The tech at Best Buy recommended that I watch some YouTube videos to learn how to properly use it and I've been taking great pictures ever since. It's a great bundle value with the camera, 2 extended lens, a battery charger, a USB cord and a carrying case.
72.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

73.author: Mike
73.review: The camera is a great starter DSLR but not as good and not as many cool features as the Rebel Ti models. Buttons seem a little cheaper and base is lighter compared to the T3i Rebel I have. The screen does not close or move, and there is not XRL or audio input which sucks. Overall a decent camera for those who wanna get into photography, but if you have the money upgrade to the "i" models.
73.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

74.author: AppleGuy
74.review: I'm not new to DSLR cameras. Had this been my first I might have been happier. Purchased this camera because of the bundle deal. Went out and took some pictures and was not impressed. Lots of noise on the edges of pictures, and the interface on the camera just didn't seem intuitive. Returned it for a Nikon D5300 and am extremely pleased. If you have never picked up a DSLR before, the T6 would probably be great. It's definitely a step below most of the other entry level DSLRs on the market though.
74.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

75.author: Brian
75.review_title: Very nice camera for the money
75.review: I upgraded to the Canon from a Nikon that's about 5 years old. I don't adjust a ton of settings on the camera unless it's necessary. I mainly like to shoot in the 'Automatic' mode which works great for everyday pictures and produces a nice quality photo. I also love the ability to upload my photos over wifi straight to my iphone. Makes posting a great quality photo on social media very quick and easy. Overall, a great camera.
75.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

76.author: Jeremy
76.review_title: Initial thoughts: Great camera for family memories
76.review: Bought this due to my children entering high school and wanting to capture memories of them before they move away. The camera was packaged well and arrived within the timeline Best Buy stated. After a few uses, it appears easy enough to use that I can get great looking pictures without needing a professional photographer taking them. If you can swing the purchase price, it is a great camera for a family to keep around. I wish I would have bought one sooner.
76.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

77.author: Martin
77.review: This is my first DSLR camera. I am an amateur photographer and was pretty good in the 80s and 90s with my 35mm film camera. Then I was given a digital point-and-shoot camera and that was the end of "composing" pictures for me. I moved from the point&shoot to the smart-phone. But I always missed the "art" part of taking pictures by framing them through a lens. This buy will allow me to get back into the feel of "photography" without the hassle of relearning a complicated system. At a great price!
77.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

78.author: Susie
78.review: We bought our camera for an important trip, and to have the resource to take better pictures all around. Our grandson also is taking photography in school and plans to use it to get started. I find the camera quite easy to use, especially with the automatic features, while still giving an opportunity to grow in learning the manual features to get better pictures. We are very pleased with the quality of the pictures.
78.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

79.author: Twitt
79.review:
My daughter bought this for her photography class and is pleased with the product overall. Good quality. She had to buy other lenses for the types of photos she wanted to take but the package came with almost everything she would need. 
The only issue was she bought it about a month before black Friday and they put it on sale for $150 less and would not give her the price adjustment. That sucks as it was a considerable difference to a student on limited income. Not good for your rep Best Buy!
79.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

80.author: ProfessionalShopper
80.review: I shopped online and at multiple stores only to find this bundle to be cheaper with the latest features on this camera. The Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera came with an extra lense, which saved me roughly $200 alone. With this camera you can download the app and transfer your images by bluetooth in a matter of minutes. Love, love, love that options. It was solded out in the store but the sales associated ordered for me. Great customer service for an awesome product.
80.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

81.author: Ameli
81.review: I love this bundle because it has just enough of what I need for a beginner. It takes beautiful pictures and very easy to use. Body, two lenses, and camera bag... For the price I got it for I couldn't be happier. Although, if you're a vlogger I wouldn't suggest this camera, the audio quality isn't ideal and there's no mic port, but if you're just going to take pictures, grab this camera!
81.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

82.author: Dave
82.review: I had a Canon T5 before and it worked great for 2 years and then I dropped it. At that point, fixing it was over $250 and at that point, a new camera just made sense. The T6 is every bit as great as the T5. If you love a great camera with all the capabilities of a film camera. I like the 300 lens quite a bit, though it does not have image stabilization so I must hold it quite steady but I do have an adequate tripod. All in all, it's a great set of lenses with an excellent camera.
82.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

83.author: Raph
83.review:
Make no mistake, although an entry level DSLR, this camera requires some reading and study. It is not point and shoot.

That said it is great fun. If you have become used to subpar smart phone photographs, you will be pleasantly surprised by the clarity of shots and creativity this camera offers. It presents challenges well worth the efforts.

A very nice machine.
83.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

84.author: Yoda
84.review: Good camera, love the features, wifi works well, easy to setup and connect to your phone, pictures are good. Disappointed on the burts as it only takes about 2 pictures per second. The Nikon 5300 came on sale about a week after with the two lenses, comparable to the canon t6 package deal but without the bag and $50 more, but definitively a better camera than the t6 if you don't care for the extra features and better configuration of the Nikon then save the extra 50 and stay with the t6
84.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

85.author: bestbuymember
85.review: I bought this camera bundle at a best buy deal. I have used it for over a year now, and it has been extremely easy to use. The configurations are easy to use, and the auto features of the camera help any amateur get some good pictures. The 75-200 mm lens is extremely useful in taking pictures that require high zoom. I used it in my brothers graduation.
85.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

86.author: Robb
86.review_title: As Close to High-End Canon Cameras
86.review: This camera outfit is a bargain! The sensor, along with the Canon lenses, create incredibly sharp images. Both stills and video look amazing, capturing details in ways that come as close to the high-end Canon cameras. I recommend it to anyone who needs affordable equipment for professional looking photographs and HD videos.
86.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

87.author: BearsFanInMD
87.review: I read a couple reviews and asked a friend, who is a professional photographer, about this camera and they were all great reviews, so I purchased it. I am a beginner when it comes to photography (no training whatsoever) and I have been able to take pictures that would have cost me hundreds of dollars and I have truly enjoyed this camera. There are still some functions I am learning about but this camera has me wanting to take pictures of everything.
87.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

88.author: Anabel
88.review: I just purchased this camera and haven't used it a lot but so far what i have used it for i can say that it is amazing great quality and amazing pics and the bundle is perfect two lenses the pouch to put your camera in the strap the battery charger.. you have to play with it and def see a couple of videos of the camera.. but in overall get price for the quality and bundle.
88.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

89.author: Eddie
89.review_title: One of the best cameras ever!
89.review: My experience with this Canon T6 is one of the best I have ever encountered. The quality of the camera itself is very high-end feels nice and sturdy in your hands when taking pictures, no matter if it's a close up or a landscape View it seems to take great quality pictures. The lenses that come with this camera are amazing easy to attached and detach off the camera. Great camera for tourist or for personal use regardless this camera make all your pictures look professionally taken.
89.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

90.author: Scamps
90.review_title: Glad to upgrade to my first digital DSLR
90.review:
Very happy with this purchase so far. I still have a lot to learn. Camera does everything that I wanted to do within my budget. 

The only concerns I have are 
1. the included bag. I wish it came with a zippered pocket in lid for extra memory cards and battery plus another divider for the camera and lenses area. Fortunately for me, I had an extra from an old camera bag that fit. 
2. I wish it came with lens cap retainers like my other Canon cameras did.
90.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

91.author: Wyldbirman
91.review_title: This DSLR is a powerful tool for a small budget
91.review:
I've been shooting pictures with a DSLR for 15 years and this Rebel is probably the best bang for the buck out of all of my previous camera kits.
Pretty easy operating features, but with a lot of specific controls for beginner and expert user alike. 
The auto settings allow you to get the image you want, even when you are still learning or honing your skills.
No complaints here!
91.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

92.author: Alatariel
92.review:
I've been wanting a camera for a little while now. This is my Christmas present this year from my husband and I absolutely love it. I'm glad I got the bundle on Black Friday as the extra lens is nice to play with. 

Both of my sisters are into photography and I wanted something to try out and maybe do as a side hobby (taking landscape pictures) just for me. 

Only thing I'm a little sad about is I didn't get the SD card that was supposed to come free per the ad on BF (2016)..
92.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

93.author: dwmack
93.review: This is my third Canon camera but my first SLR camera and thus far its all I expected. Currently taking a camera class and its interesting to note that 8 of the 13 students have the Canon Rebel T6 with the 18-55 and 75-300mm lens. You really need to down load the full camera manual from the web site to get the most of your camera features. Would have been nice to have had U/V filters included to protect your new lens. Looking to purchase a lens hood and spare battery now.
93.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

94.author: NBCitizen
94.review_title: Good bundle to get into more serious photography
94.review: We were looking for better pictures than our phones and point and shoot camera were giving us. This has good protection and storage from the included bag and the telephoto lens allows us to get good action shots, even from the stands. It has accurate auto-focus, pluis there are standard photo modes (portrait, action, etc.) and manual modes that allow you to get a bit more artistic when the mood strikes. Overall a good purchase.
94.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

95.author: Stevo
95.review: I bought this camera to get nice photos for my daughter's graduation events. Cell phone pics just weren't going to cut it! Really easy to use if you spend a little time figuring out the functions. Take great photos even in auto mode. The 75-300mm zoom lens in the bundle is great and really help when your far away in an audience. I had the old film Canon Rebel - a lot has improved in 25 years!
95.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

96.author: hima
96.review_title: Canon - EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm
96.review: This is my first DSLR camera and I love it. It takes wonderful pictures and with the kit, I have enjoyed it so far. The wifi and NFC capabilities make transferring images a breeze. Using the Canon app, you are able to shoot without touching the camera. There is a learning curve, but the auto settings are great to begin with and YouTube has all the information you need to learn more advance techniques.
96.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

97.author: Kyle
97.review: If your looking for a camera to take you to the next level this is the one for you. I saw other cameras for 2x as much as this one and I feel like pictures are so much better. One of the things I found that helped me is finding the right software when uploading the pictures. The battery life on this camera is weeks without a charge. I recommend getting a SD card.
97.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

98.author: SharonR
98.review:
I had been looking for an easy to use camera that had interchangeable lenses. A friend of my grandson's had purchased a camera similar to this one, and really liked it. The package deal was the final aspect that sold me on the camera, allowing me to get two lenses and the case for one price.
The photos from this camera are clear, bright and beautiful. A definite for a beginner, or someone who doesn't want to spend thousands on a good camera.
98.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

99.author: ritreeman
99.review: I shoot on a semi - professional basis and anyone that would tell you that this camera can't compete with the big boys doesn't know what they are talking about. I'll put my results against theirs and I won't come up lacking. Good camera for the novice or pro. Great value for the money.
99.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

100.author: meeeep
100.review_title: Love the camera for the price.
100.review: After owning a Nikon Coolpix B500 and using some other nikons. When I sold the coolpix, I was determined that I would get another Nikon, but I also know a few people who have this canon and they love it. I decided to give it a go. Once you learn how to use the different modes, the camera is quite nice. I won’t say it’s perfect since lighting is difficult, but overall, it has given me some really nice quality photos.
100.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

101.author: Nubie
101.review: This was a Black Friday purchase. I was looking for a camera to take with me on a cruise to the Antarctic. I was expecting to see spectacular scenery and also come close to the wildlife (mostly penguins) so I needed a camera that could accomplish both yet be simple enough for a novice like me. Luckily there was someone on the cruise who helped me to understand the various functions. I came away with great pictures so I would definitely recommend this one.
101.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

102.author: Yajaira
102.review_title: Great camera for a beginner/ hobbyist
102.review: Camera has all the features you would expect from a point and shoot camera, but if that's what you're looking for I suggest buying something less expensive. Otherwise, this is a great camera for beginner photographers who want to be more creative and have more control of the image composition. It's a great price for all that you are getting. And if you start charging for your work then the camera will pay for itself tenfold in no time.
102.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

103.author: JimF
103.review: I was looking to venture into photography and was looking for an easy to use DSLR camera and this one is perfect. Put it in automatic mode and shoot away. I will be trying some manual setting as I get more familiar with the camera. I got the bundle with the longer lens. Great deal
103.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

104.author: Bhaumik2688
104.review: This camera is so easy to use and take amazing pictures. All the features are explained in the manual and if you do a little study you can take excellent pictures. This is the perfect camera for someone like me who wants to take "professional" pictures. I would recommend getting the Geek squad coverage as it includes free services and maintenance of the camera.
104.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

105.author: DigitalQueen
105.review: This is not the latest version of Canon's Rebel, but it is still awesome, especially for the price. Many, many years ago I got the original Rebel when it first came out and it was more than twice this price. This is my third one! Loved it then and am still loving it now. Likely will always stick with a Canon for life since the pictures it takes are fantastic. This kit with the lenses and case is perfect.
105.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

106.author: crzysmilez
106.review:
I liked the Camera, easy to understand with all the features & its performance was great when it came to wifi & has a great android App for Sharing pictures, i didnt like the weight as it became unbalanced & Heavy.
Heres 2 Pictures of its overall performance with macro photography using 35mm & Distance using the 300mm lense.
106.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

107.author: BarbPA
107.review_title: Great camera - just getting used to it
107.review: I had a Canon Power Shot SX40, and I love it. But I decided I wanted to have the ability to take shots further away - and this camera is great for that. I took some photos at the Flight 93 Memorial last week, and the zoom lens is excellent! It is a step up from the Power Shot, but not too complicated for a casual photo taker like me.
107.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

108.author: ah196
108.review: Great camera and easy to use out of the box with the automatic modes. Many functions/modes allow for user to set customizable settings versus the preset. Recommend watching YouTube videos on the basics as it allows user to leave the realm of the preset settings and experiment with their own adjustments. Really clear pictures and packaged nicely.
108.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

109.author: antDoria
109.review: This is a great camera when I bought it one of the best by representatives told me that it did come with a microphone for one thing I was upset about is it's not a microphone port it's actually a remote port anyway I had to return the camera and I mentioned to Best Buy that I went into the store with specs and didn't get but I needed they actually reimbursed me 15% off my next purchase and a $20 gift card in the mail
109.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

110.author: Jheaton48
110.review: Had been contemplating moving up from point and shoot to DSLR for some time. The price on the Canon EOS T6, made that decision easy. And after using it to take all our holiday pictures, I can honestly say it's as easy to use and point and shoot cameras. Granted, I haven't delved too deep into using all the manual settings yet, but the built in auto settings are nice and the pictures look great.
110.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

111.author: NewGirl
111.review: I've used mine extensively, taking thousands of pics. Wildlife, landscapes, macro's, still life's and even sports action pics. Easy kit to learn about shutter speeds, apertures, etc. I didn't rate 5 stars because it did/does exhibit a known error occasionally (Shutter, Mirror Operations or Lens Communication: Err 01), but I can usually get past that annoyance eventually.
111.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

112.author: Blu3andY3ll0w
112.review: I purchased the Canon - EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm IS II and EF 75-300mm III lens for my wife for her birthday and to take on a trip. It is a very nice entry level model in the DSL space and I feel like I got a great deal on it. The purchase price was $50 lower than I had seen it anywhere else so kudos to Best Buy. It is an excellent all in one kit with two lenses and the carrying bag. My wife was thrilled.
112.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

113.author: Nikki
113.review: I bought this camera for a gift. It was for a 16 year old young lady from my church. The only gift she really wanted. Your staff went beyond out of there way to be sure she would have it for Christmas. And she was using it within minutes of taking it out of the box with ease. To say the least it was a wonderful success on all accepts. I would reccommend this camera to everyone for a first camera. And would buy it again.
113.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

114.author: SeaLion
